title.narrative: 1.1. NATIONAL CP POLICY AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: National and subnational institutional mechanisms established to identify, refer and report instances of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Children With Disabilities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially the most deprived, access and utilize quality and equitable protection, education, health and nutrition services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational institutional mechanisms established to identify, refer and report instances of violence, abuse,exploitation and neglect of children

description.narrative: The final draft of the Social Services Strategy was submitted to the Cabinet of Ministers following the review of line Ministries and public discussions with NGO/CSO partners. A new Social Service Agency was established under the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of the Population.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

actual.value: 2020:Community based and family support social services and local referral system functions based on the standards and SOP's are recognized by MoLSPP as a model for national replication.
